markdownRemark.html:
Score: 100

dailyrecord.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website for a daily newspaper covering Morris County in northern New Jersey.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

The Daily Record  is owned by the publicly traded Gannett Company Inc., a McLean, Virginia-based chain of more than 100 news organizations around the U.S., including its flagship publication USA Today. The company’s other news properties make up the USA Today Network, which Gannett formed in 2015. Its publications have won numerous awards, including three Pulitzer Prizes in 2018.

Gannett also owns Newsquest, a company of more than 165 newspaper brands and 40 magazines in the United Kingdom.

Gannett generates revenue through advertisements and subscriptions for its printed publications, websites, and other digital products. Dailyrecord.com runs advertising and features a subscription paywall.

Content

The site covers government, politics, crime, culture, business, and sports in Morris County, New Jersey. A Transportation section includes stories about infrastructure and NJ Transit, the public bus and rail agency many Morris County residents depend upon to commute to jobs in New York City.

In addition to its original content, the site publishes stories from other outlets in the USA Today network and by The Associated Press. Articles about New Jersey state government are provided by the Gannett statehouse bureau in Trenton.

Credibility

Stories typically are balanced and well-sourced, including interviews with police, local and county officials, and others with first-hand knowledge of events. Images are credited to reliable sources. Headlines accurately reflect content.

The dailyrecord.com publishes ethics and corrections policies -- guidelines that are shared across the USA Today Network. The guidelines include a commitment to correct any errors promptly. Corrections on the site are appended at the bottom of stories, with an explanation of what was changed.

The site publishes opinion in a separate section.

Transparency

Articles list authors below the headline and link to their email addresses and previous stories. A Reporters Index lists editors and reporters, along with their phone numbers and email addresses.

Dailyrecord.com discloses its ownership on its About Us page. Advertisements and sponsored content are distinguishable from sponsored content.

History

The newspaper was founded in 1900. It was purchased by Gannett in 1998.

Written by:
Jennie Kamin

Edited by:
Peggy Ackermann Eric Effron
